content:
I'm stuck at the following goal

τ σ ρ : TF
F G : τ ⟶ σ
H : ρ ⟶ τ
r : val
heq : (F (H r).fst).fst = (G (H r).fst).fst ∧
  (fun x => (F (H r).fst).snd ((H r).snd x)) ≍ fun x => (G (H r).fst).snd ((H r).snd x)
x : coe r
⊢ (F (H r).fst).snd ((H r).snd x) ≍ (G (H r).fst).snd ((H r).snd x)

If I had a hfunext_iff : (f ≍ f')↔ (∀ (a : α) (a' : α'), a ≍ a' → f a ≍ f' a') , then I can rewrite heq.2 with it and specialize heq.2 with a:=x,a':=x to prove the goal. But despite that hfunext exists under namespace Function, hfunext_iff is nowhere to find.

mwe :

import Mathlib

open CategoryTheory
open Function

class TF where
  val : Sort*
  coe : (val → Sort*)

instance (τ : TF) : CoeSort τ.1 Sort* where
  coe t := τ.2 t

abbrev TF.Hom (τ σ : TF.{u,v}) (t : τ.1) := (s:σ.1) ×' (↑t → ↑s)

namespace TF

instance : Category TF.{u+1,v+1} where
  Hom τ σ := ∀ t, TF.Hom τ σ t
  id τ t := ⟨t, id⟩
  comp F G t := ⟨(G (F t).1).1, (G (F t).1).2 ∘ (F t).2 ⟩

The whole file is 

import Mathlib

open CategoryTheory
open Function

class TF where
  val : Sort*
  coe : (val → Sort*)

instance (τ : TF) : CoeSort τ.1 Sort* where
  coe t := τ.2 t

abbrev TF.Hom (τ σ : TF.{u,v}) (t : τ.1) := (s:σ.1) ×' (↑t → ↑s)

-- namespace TF

instance : Category TF.{u+1,v+1} where
  Hom τ σ := ∀ t, TF.Hom τ σ t
  id τ t := ⟨t, id⟩
  comp F G t := ⟨(G (F t).1).1, (G (F t).1).2 ∘ (F t).2 ⟩

def Eql {τ σ : TF} (F G : τ ⟶ σ ) : TF where
  val := {t : τ.1 // (F t).1 = (G t).1 }
  coe := fun ⟨t, _⟩ => {x : t // (F t).2 x ≍ (G t).2 x}

def eql {τ σ : TF} (F G : τ ⟶  σ ) : (Eql F G) ⟶ τ := by
  intro ⟨t, _⟩
  refine ⟨t, fun ⟨x, _⟩ => x⟩

lemma hfunext_iff {α α' : Sort u} {β : α → Sort v} {β' : α' → Sort v} {f : ∀ a, β a} {f' : ∀ a, β' a}
    (hα : α = α') : (f ≍ f') ↔ (∀ a a', a ≍ a' → f a ≍ f' a') := by sorry

example {τ σ ρ : TF} (F G : τ ⟶ σ ) (H : ρ ⟶ τ ) (heq : H ≫ F = H ≫ G):
  Σ' (K : ρ ⟶ (Eql F G)), K ≫ (eql F G) =  H
  := by
  rw [funext_iff] at heq
  simp [CategoryStruct.comp] at heq
  refine ⟨?_, ?_⟩
  · intro r
    simp [Eql]
    specialize heq r
    --obtain ⟨h1,h2⟩ := heq
    refine ⟨⟨(H r).1, heq.1⟩, ?_⟩
    simp
    intro x
    use (H r).2 x
    unfold comp at heq
you should try to generalize F (H r).1 and G (H r).1 and then case on them so that heq.1 becomes equality of free variables, and then you can subst it
Now I see : I seem to have misunderstood HEq

It seems the main issue was a misunderstanding of HEq—generalizing and casing, as Kenny suggested, makes sense here. You might not need hfunext_iff after all. Try exploring similar equality-handling lemmas via LeanFinder (www.leanfinder.org).
@leanfinder Lean handling HEq between dependent function results without hfunext_iff

Here’s what I found:

  • theorem Function.hfunext {α α' : Sort u} {β : α → Sort v} {β' : α' → Sort v} {f : ∀ a, β a} {f' : ∀ a, β' a} (hα : α = α') (h : ∀ a a', HEq a a' → HEq (f a) (f' a')) : HEq f f' := by subst hα have : ∀a, HEq (f a) (f' a) := fun a ↦ h a a (HEq.refl a) have : β = β' := by funext a; exact type_eq_of_heq (this a) subst this apply heq_of_eq funext a exact eq_of_heq (this a) "Given two types α\alphaα and α′\alpha'α′ in universe uuu, and type families β:α→Sort v\beta : \alpha \to \text{Sort } vβ:α→Sort v and β′:α′→Sort v\beta' : \alpha' \to \text{Sort } vβ′:α′→Sort v, if α=α′\alpha = \alpha'α=α′ and for any a:αa : \alphaa:α and a′:α′a' : \alpha'a′:α′ with a≡a′a \equiv a'a≡a′ (heterogeneous equality) we have f(a)≡f′(a′)f(a) \equiv f'(a')f(a)≡f′(a′), then the functions f:∀a,βaf : \forall a, \beta af:∀a,βa and f′:∀a,β′af' : \forall a, \beta' af′:∀a,β′a are heterogeneously equal, i.e., f≡f′f \equiv f'f≡f′." (score: 0.746)

  • theorem congr_heq {α β γ : Sort _} {f : α → γ} {g : β → γ} {x : α} {y : β} (h₁ : HEq f g) (h₂ : HEq x y) : f x = g y := by cases h₂; cases h₁; rfl "For types α,β,γ\alpha, \beta, \gammaα,β,γ and functions f:α→γf : \alpha \to \gammaf:α→γ, g:β→γg : \beta \to \gammag:β→γ, if fff is heterogeneous equal to ggg (denoted as f≈gf \approx gf≈g) and x:αx : \alphax:α is heterogeneous equal to y:βy : \betay:β (denoted as x≈yx \approx yx≈y), then f(x)=g(y)f(x) = g(y)f(x)=g(y)." (score: 0.734)

  • theorem congr_arg_heq {β : α → Sort*} (f : ∀ a, β a) : ∀ {a₁ a₂ : α}, a₁ = a₂ → HEq (f a₁) (f a₂) | _, _, rfl => HEq.rfl "For any dependent function f:∀a,β(a)f : \forall a, \beta(a)f:∀a,β(a) and any elements a1,a2a_1, a_2a1​,a2​ of type α\alphaα, if a1=a2a_1 = a_2a1​=a2​ then the values f(a1)f(a_1)f(a1​) and f(a2)f(a_2)f(a2​) are heterogeneously equal (denoted as HEq\text{HEq}HEq)." (score: 0.728)

  • lemma congr_2_heq' {α α'} {β : α → Prop} {γ : α → Type u} {β' : α' → Prop} {γ' : α' → Type u} {a : α} {a' : α'} (ha : HEq a a') (f : ∀ a : α, β a → γ a) (f' : ∀ a' : α', β' a' → γ' a') (b : β a) (b' : β' (cast (by cases ha; rfl) a')) (hB : HEq β β') (hC : HEq γ γ') (hf : HEq f f') : HEq (f a b) (f' a' b') := by cases ha; apply congr_2_heq (hf := hf) (ha := by rfl) simpa using hB; simpa using hC "Given two types α\alphaα and α′\alpha'α′ with predicates β:α→Prop\beta : \alpha \to \text{Prop}β:α→Prop and β′:α′→Prop\beta' : \alpha' \to \text{Prop}β′:α′→Prop, and type families γ:α→Type u\gamma : \alpha \to \text{Type } uγ:α→Type u and γ′:α′→Type u\gamma' : \alpha' \to \text{Type } uγ′:α′→Type u, if a≡a′a \equiv a'a≡a′ (heterogeneous equality), β≡β′\beta \equiv \beta'β≡β′, γ≡γ′\gamma \equiv \gamma'γ≡γ′, and f≡f′f \equiv f'f≡f′ for functions f:∀a,β(a)→γ(a)f : \forall a, \beta(a) \to \gamma(a)f:∀a,β(a)→γ(a) and f′:∀a′,β′(a′)→γ′(a′)f' : \forall a', \beta'(a') \to \gamma'(a')f′:∀a′,β′(a′)→γ′(a′), then f(a,b)≡f′(a′,b′)f(a, b) \equiv f'(a', b')f(a,b)≡f′(a′,b′) for b:β(a)b : \beta(a)b:β(a) and b′:β′(cast (by cases ha;rfl)a′)b' : \beta'(\text{cast } (\text{by cases } ha; \text{rfl}) a')b′:β′(cast (by cases ha;rfl)a′). This shows that applying fff and f′f'f′ to corresponding arguments, with b′b'b′ adjusted by casting, results in heterogeneous equality." (score: 0.718)

  • lemma congr_2_heq {α α'} {β : α → Prop} {γ : α → Type u} {β' : α → Prop} {γ' : α → Type u} {a : α} {a' : α'} (ha : HEq a a') (f : ∀ a : α, β a → γ a) (f' : ∀ a'' : α', β' (cast (by cases ha; rfl) a'') → γ' (cast (by cases ha; rfl) a'')) (b : β a) (b' : β' (cast (by cases ha; rfl) a')) (hb : β = β') (hct : γ = γ') (hf : HEq f f') : HEq (f a b) (f' a' b') := by cases ha; subst hct hb; cases hf; rfl "Given two types α\alphaα and α′\alpha'α′ and predicates β:α→Prop\beta : \alpha \to \text{Prop}β:α→Prop and β′:α′→Prop\beta' : \alpha' \to \text{Prop}β′:α′→Prop, along with type families γ:α→Type u\gamma : \alpha \to \text{Type } uγ:α→Type u and γ′:α′→Type u\gamma' : \alpha' \to \text{Type } uγ′:α′→Type u, if a≡a′a \equiv a'a≡a′ (heterogeneous equality), β=β′\beta = \beta'β=β′, γ=γ′\gamma = \gamma'γ=γ′, and f≡f′f \equiv f'f≡f′ for functions f:∀a,βa→γaf : \forall a, \beta a \to \gamma af:∀a,βa→γa and f′:∀a′,β′(a′)→γ′(a′)f' : \forall a', \beta'(a') \to \gamma'(a')f′:∀a′,β′(a′)→γ′(a′), then f(a,b)≡f′(a′,b′)f(a, b) \equiv f'(a', b')f(a,b)≡f′(a′,b′) for b:β(a)b : \beta(a)b:β(a) and b′:β′(a′)b' : \beta'(a')b′:β′(a′). This means the application of fff and f′f'f′ to corresponding arguments is heterogeneously equal." (score: 0.714)

  • theorem eqRec_heq_iff_heq {α : Sort _} {a : α} {motive : (a' : α) → a = a' → Sort _} {x : motive a rfl} {a' : α} {e : a = a'} {β : Sort _} {y : β} : HEq (@Eq.rec α a motive x a' e) y ↔ HEq x y := by subst e; rfl "For any type α\alphaα, element a∈αa \in \alphaa∈α, a motive motive:(a′:α)→a=a′→Sort∗\text{motive} : (a' : \alpha) \to a = a' \to \text{Sort}_*motive:(a′:α)→a=a′→Sort∗​, element x∈motive(a,rfl)x \in \text{motive}(a, \text{rfl})x∈motive(a,rfl), element a′∈αa' \in \alphaa′∈α, equality e:a=a′e : a = a'e:a=a′, type β\betaβ, and element y∈βy \in \betay∈β, the heterogeneous equality HEq(Eq.rec(x,e),y)\text{HEq}(\text{Eq.rec}(x, e), y)HEq(Eq.rec(x,e),y) holds if and only if HEq(x,y)\text{HEq}(x, y)HEq(x,y) holds." (score: 0.705)

  • theorem congrFun₂ {β : α → Sort _} {γ : ∀ a, β a → Sort _} {f g : ∀ a b, γ a b} (h : f = g) (a : α) (b : β a) : f a b = g a b := congrFun (congrFun h _) _ "For any types α\alphaα, β\betaβ, and γ\gammaγ, and functions f,g:∀a,b,γ(a,b)f, g : \forall a, b, \gamma(a, b)f,g:∀a,b,γ(a,b), if f=gf = gf=g, then for any a∈αa \in \alphaa∈α and b∈β(a)b \in \beta(a)b∈β(a), we have f(a,b)=g(a,b)f(a, b) = g(a, b)f(a,b)=g(a,b). This follows by applying the equality f=gf = gf=g to the arguments aaa and bbb. The theorem essentially states that if two functions are equal, then their applications to the same arguments are also equal." (score: 0.703)

  • theorem heq_eqRec_iff_heq {α : Sort _} {a : α} {motive : (a' : α) → a = a' → Sort _} {x : motive a rfl} {a' : α} {e : a = a'} {β : Sort _} {y : β} : HEq y (@Eq.rec α a motive x a' e) ↔ HEq y x := by subst e; rfl "For any type α\alphaα, element a∈αa \in \alphaa∈α, motive motive:(a′:α)→a=a′→Sort∗\text{motive} : (a' : \alpha) \to a = a' \to \text{Sort}_*motive:(a′:α)→a=a′→Sort∗​, element x∈motive(a,rfl)x \in \text{motive}(a, \text{rfl})x∈motive(a,rfl), element a′∈αa' \in \alphaa′∈α, equality e:a=a′e : a = a'e:a=a′, type β\betaβ, and element y∈βy \in \betay∈β, the heterogeneous equality HEq(y,Eq.rec(x,a′,e))\text{HEq}(y, \text{Eq.rec}(x, a', e))HEq(y,Eq.rec(x,a′,e)) holds if and only if HEq(y,x)\text{HEq}(y, x)HEq(y,x) holds." (score: 0.702)

  • theorem Fin.heq_fun₂_iff {α : Sort*} {k l k' l' : ℕ} (h : k = l) (h' : k' = l') {f : Fin k → Fin k' → α} {g : Fin l → Fin l' → α} : HEq f g ↔ ∀ (i : Fin k) (j : Fin k'), f i j = g ⟨(i : ℕ), h ▸ i.2⟩ ⟨(j : ℕ), h' ▸ j.2⟩ := by subst h subst h' simp [funext_iff] "Let k,l,k′,l′k, l, k', l'k,l,k′,l′ be natural numbers with k=lk = lk=l and k′=l′k' = l'k′=l′, and let ααα be a type. For any two functions f:Fin k→Fin k′→αf : \text{Fin } k → \text{Fin } k' → αf:Fin k→Fin k′→α and g:Fin l→Fin l′→αg : \text{Fin } l → \text{Fin } l' → αg:Fin l→Fin l′→α, the following are equivalent:

  1. fff and ggg are heterogeneously equal (i.e., equal up to the equality of their domains).
  2. For all i∈Fin ki \in \text{Fin } ki∈Fin k and j∈Fin k′j \in \text{Fin } k'j∈Fin k′, we have f(i)(j)=g(⟨i,h⟩)(⟨j,h′⟩)f(i)(j) = g(\langle i, h \rangle)(\langle j, h' \rangle)f(i)(j)=g(⟨i,h⟩)(⟨j,h′⟩), where ⟨⋅,⋅⟩\langle \cdot, \cdot \rangle⟨⋅,⋅⟩ denotes the construction of a Fin element from a natural number and a proof that it is within bounds, and h,h′h, h'h,h′ are the given equalities k=lk = lk=l and k′=l′k' = l'k′=l′ respectively." (score: 0.702)
  • theorem Fin.heq_fun_iff {α : Sort*} {k l : ℕ} (h : k = l) {f : Fin k → α} {g : Fin l → α} : HEq f g ↔ ∀ i : Fin k, f i = g ⟨(i : ℕ), h ▸ i.2⟩ := by subst h simp [funext_iff] "Let kkk and lll be natural numbers such that k=lk = lk=l, and let f ⁣:Fin k→αf \colon \mathrm{Fin}\,k \to \alphaf:Fink→α and g ⁣:Fin l→αg \colon \mathrm{Fin}\,l \to \alphag:Finl→α be functions. Then fff and ggg are heterogeneously equal (denoted by HEq f g\mathrm{HEq}\,f\,gHEqfg) if and only if for every i∈Fin ki \in \mathrm{Fin}\,ki∈Fink, we have f(i)=g(⟨i,h⋅i.2⟩)f(i) = g(\langle i, h \cdot i.2 \rangle)f(i)=g(⟨i,h⋅i.2⟩), where ⟨i,h⋅i.2⟩\langle i, h \cdot i.2 \rangle⟨i,h⋅i.2⟩ denotes the element of Fin l\mathrm{Fin}\,lFinl whose underlying natural number is iii and whose proof is adjusted by the equality h ⁣:k=lh \colon k = lh:k=l." (score: 0.700)
